title: 2 Deadly Shootings in 2 Days Highlight Israel’s Failure to Address Gaza’s Power Vacuum
summary: Over the weekend, Israeli soldiers shot Palestinians near an Israeli-backed aid site and a U.N. convoy. Both episodes pointed to Israel’s refusal to allow new governance structures to emerge.

title: Israel Refuses to Renew Visa of Top UN Humanitarian Official for Gaza
summary: The head of the agency that helps oversee international aid deliveries to the territory had criticized the impact of Israeli policy on civilians.

title: Syrian Government Evacuates Bedouin Families After Deadly Clashes
summary: The violence in Sweida Province between groups from Bedouin tribes and the Druse minority renewed fears of sectarian conflict and drew Israeli attacks before a cease-fire was announced Saturday.

title: How Trump Deflected MAGA’s Wrath Over Epstein, at Least for Now
summary: By tapping into other grievances, President Trump managed to turn one of the most fractious moments for his base into a unifying one.

title: An Accuser’s Story Suggests How Trump Might Appear in the Epstein Files
summary: A former Jeffrey Epstein employee said that she told the F.B.I. in 1996 and 2006 about what she considered a troubling encounter with Donald J. Trump.

title: Conviction of Man in Killing of Etan Patz Is Overturned
summary: Pedro Hernandez, a former bodega stock clerk, had confessed years after the 1979 crime to luring Etan Patz, 6, into a basement in SoHo. The case shook New York City.

title: Pedro Hernandez Found Guilty of Kidnapping and Killing Etan Patz in 1979
summary: The verdict is a long-awaited step in solving the mystery that bedeviled investigators and forever changed the way parents watched over their children.

title: Judge Challenges Trump Administration in Hearing on Harvard Funding
summary: In a courtroom in Boston on Monday, a lawyer for Harvard called the Trump administration’s case against the school “cooked up.”

title: Disabled Americans Fear What Medicaid Cuts Could Do to Them
summary: The White House says roughly $1 trillion in Medicaid cuts won’t limit home- and community-based care. Health care experts disagree.

title: An Attack on the Medical Establishment Buried in an 1,800-Page Regulation
summary: If approved, a new rule could end the entrenched pay advantages for specialists like surgeons over other doctors.

title: The Trouble With Wanting Men
summary: Women are so fed up with dating men that the phenomenon even has a name: heterofatalism. So what do we do with our desire?

title: A Mill Town Lost Its Mill. What Is It Now?
summary: Locals in Canton, N.C., are trying to figure out what’s next after losing the thing that gave them an identity: their beloved, stinky paper mill.

title: In Japan, Anti-Establishment Parties Resonate With Young Voters
summary: The success of new political parties focused on wages, immigration and an unresponsive political elite highlights the frustrations of many working-age people in Japan.

title: How Did the Number of Missing After Texas Floods Drop So Drastically?
summary: Last week, officials said 97 people were missing in Kerr County. Now, it’s down to three. The drop is substantial, but such wild fluctuations can happen after disasters.

title: Russia Launches Heavy Strikes Despite Trump Arms Pledge to Ukraine
summary: The barrage of exploding drones and missiles appeared to be the most intense attack since President Trump announced a plan to get more weapons for Kyiv.

title: Ukraine Ups Its Arms Production, Asking Allies to Pay for It
summary: There is a growing drive to make the country more self-reliant in weapons manufacturing as it faces Russia’s superior firepower. That requires a lot of money from Western backers.

title: Bangladesh Air Force Jet Crashes Into School, Killing at Least 20
summary: More than 170 people were injured after the training aircraft crashed, military officials said. The country’s interim leader called the loss “irreparable.”

title: Opinion: The Path to Peace in the Middle East (and a Nobel Prize for Trump)
summary: A possible path to peace in the Middle East.

title: Regret, Thy Name Is Hawley. And Murkowski. And Musk.
summary: The price of pleasing Trump grows steeper.

title: A.I. vs. A.I.
summary: We examine how the technology is being used against itself.

title: Did Jeju Air Pilots Shut Down Wrong Engine Before Deadly Crash?
summary: Investigators found the Jeju Air flight crash-landed with only its badly damaged right engine on, but experts warned against drawing early conclusions.

title: Minnesota Lawmaker Convicted of Burglary Plans to Resign, Ending Democratic Majority
summary: The resignation of State Senator Nicole Mitchell will leave the State Senate with even numbers of Democrats and Republicans. A special election will break the tie.

title: SkyWest Flight Aborts Landing to Avoid Midair Collision Near Military Base
summary: After the passenger jet landed safely in North Dakota, the pilot told passengers that he had made an “aggressive maneuver” to avoid hitting a military aircraft.

title: Chinese Car Giants Rush Into Brazil With Dreams of Dominating a Continent
summary: As the likes of Ford and Mercedes retreat, Great Wall Motor and BYD are building factories and bringing affordable EVs and hybrids to one of the world’s biggest markets.
